Recent updates in New York include a mysterious foul odor affecting Staten Island homes, high RSV cases leading to increased hospitalizations, and the FDA recalling oysters due to potential norovirus contamination, alongside ongoing discussions about housing policies and public safety reforms in response to rising violence.

### Risks & Alerts

- Mysterious foul odor reported in Staten Island neighborhood, affecting residents' homes. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- RSV cases and hospitalizations are currently at high levels across New York state. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- FDA recalls Stellar Bay Shellfish oysters sold in 10 states, including New York, due to possible norovirus contamination. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- 70-year-old woman found dead on a bench in the Bronx; investigation ongoing. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
